column1: This is a picture of the horse that refuses to run over children. His name is Prince. Once his master was driving him along a narrow street
column2: when Prince saw an infant creeping along across the street right in his way.Prince at once slackened his speed; and though his master
column3: who did not know that the infant lay in the way
column5: Prince knew better than to hurt the poor little infant.At last the good horse stopped short
column6: and refused to move. His master got out of the buggy to see what was the matter; and there
column8: was a baby on its knees.Was not Prince a good
column9: wise horse to refuse to harm the baby? Another time
column10: when a little boy came up behind him
column11: when the flies were pestering him
column14: just lifted up one of his hind-feet
